definitions.definition: ( music ) A musical instrument producing a sound when struck , similar to a bell (e.g. a tubular metal bar) or actually a bell. Often used in the plural to refer to the set: the chimes .
examples: Hugo had a recording of someone playing the chimes against a background of surf noise that she found calming.
Sylvia was a chime player in the school orchestra.

definitions.definition: An individual ringing component of such a set.
examples: Peter removed the C♯ chime from its mounting so that he could get at the dust that had accumulated underneath.

definitions.definition: A small bell or other ringing or tone -making device as a component of some other device.
examples: The professor had stuffed a wad of gum into the chime of his doorbell so that he wouldn't be bothered.

definitions.definition: The sound of such an instrument or device.
examples: The copier gave a chime to indicate that it had finished printing.

definitions.definition: A small hammer or other device used to strike a bell.
examples: Strike the bell with the brass chime hanging on the chain next to it.

main_definition: ( music ) A musical instrument producing a sound when struck , similar to a bell (e.g. a tubular metal bar) or actually a bell. Often used in the plural to refer to the set: the chimes .
secondary_definitions: An individual ringing component of such a set.
A small bell or other ringing or tone -making device as a component of some other device.
The sound of such an instrument or device.
A small hammer or other device used to strike a bell.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of chine ( “ edge of a cask; part of a ship; etc. ” ) .

main_definition: Alternative form of chine ( “ edge of a cask; part of a ship; etc. ” ) .
